item.title: Nearer my God: Foxing’s Transcendental Rock Show
item.author: Jonathan Lu,
item.description: I saw several bands live over the summer. Florence + The Machine and The National’s anthemic chamber pop at BST in front of thousands in Hyde park, Black Midi drawing a respectable crowd at EartH despite having released virtually no music (I also wrote a review for their show I’m sure nobody read) …

item.title: The noisy, discordant sound of history: Black Midi
item.author: Jonathan Lu,
item.description: Black Midi had released very little music as I walked down the steps to the EartH concert hall. In fact, when I first heard of the band from a friend of a friend of the band at a gig a year ago, they had released no music at all. Much of the band’s following has been formed in a similar way, through …
